Title:
Hosts of asexual morph of Erysiphe quercicola from
Thailand.
Keywords:
Erysiphaceae, Host range, Molecular phylogeny, Powdery
mildew, Quercus phillyreoides
Abstract:
Between 2002 and 2017, asexual morphs of powdery mildews
(Erysiphales) were collected in Thailand from the following hosts:
Cassia fistula, Castanopsis argyrophylla, Durio zibethinus, Jatropha
curcas, Kydia calycina, Heavea brasiliensis, Hodgsonia macrocarpa,
Mallotus philippinensis, Mimosa pudica, Nephelium lappaceum, Tamarindus
indica and Ziziphus jujube. Combined molecular and morphological
analyses revealed that all these specimens belong to Erysiphe
quercicola. These powdery mildews are nested within the E. quercicola
clade. This research shows that while sexual morph of Erysiphe
quercicola is only found on oak species (Quercus, Fagaceae), its asexul
morph has a broad host range, particularly in the tropics. Cassia
fistula, C. argyrophylla, J. curcas, K. calycina, H. macrocarpa, M.
philippinensis, M. pudica, T. indica and Z. jujube are new host records
for E. quercicola worldwide.
